titlestmt.titleproper: Records of the Faculty of the Wagner Free Institute of Science 1885-1911
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Records of the Faculty of the Wagner Free Institute of Science

bioghist.p: Incorporated by William Wagner in 1855, the Wagner Free Institute is a natural history museum and educational institution in Philadelphia that is dedicated to providing free public education in the sciences. William Wagner originally offered free lectures and classes in his home and at Spring Garden Hall. He later constructed an Institute building, which opened to the public in 1865. The Institute's educational programming is offered onsite and at locations around Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists mainly of rough and final copies of the minutes of the meetings of the Faculty of the Wagner Free Institute of Science for the years 1885-1886, 1903, and 1906-1911. The minutes during this period were submitted by the Secretary of the Faculty (for most of this period, Samuel Tobias Wagner) to the Director, to be presented to the Board of Trustees. The collection also includes correspondence concerning lectures, course lists, and the awarding of certificates to students.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Wagner Free Institute of Science: Minutes of the Faculty (89-035) and Roll books and general attendance records of the Faculty (90-030).
